dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
Vinod Nair
Geoffrey Hinton
dcterms:description: CIFAR10 is a dataset consisting of 60,000 32x32 color images in 10 classes, with 6,000 images per class. It is commonly used for training machine learning models in image classification tasks.
dcterms:title: CIFAR10

dcterms:creator: Hadi Pouransari
Saman Ghili
dcterms:description: TinyImageNet is a smaller version of the ImageNet dataset, containing 200 classes with 500 training images and 50 validation images per class. It is used for visual recognition tasks.
dcterms:title: TinyImageNet

dcterms:creator: David Lopez-Paz
Marcâ€™Aurelio Ranzato
dcterms:description: R-MNIST is a variant of the MNIST dataset where the images of handwritten digits are rotated by random angles. It is used to evaluate models in the context of continual learning.
dcterms:title: R-MNIST

dcterms:creator: Pietro Buzzega
Matteo Boschini
Angelo Porrello
Davide Abati
Simone Calderara
dcterms:description: MNIST360 is a dataset that presents batches of two consecutive MNIST images, exposing the model to both sharp and smooth distribution shifts. It is used for evaluating continual learning methods.
dcterms:title: MNIST360

dcterms:creator: Fei Mi
Lingjing Kong
Tao Lin
Kaicheng Yu
Boi Faltings
dcterms:description: GCIL (Generalized Class Incremental Learning) is a dataset designed for evaluating models in a class-incremental learning setting, where classes can overlap and the sample size for each class can vary.
dcterms:title: GCIL

dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
Vinod Nair
Geoffrey Hinton
dcterms:description: S-CIFAR10 is a subset of the CIFAR10 dataset, used for evaluating models in a continual learning context.
dcterms:title: S-CIFAR10

dcterms:creator: Hadi Pouransari
Saman Ghili
dcterms:description: S-TinyImg is a subset of the TinyImageNet dataset, used for evaluating models in a continual learning context.
dcterms:title: S-TinyImg

dcterms:creator: Fei Mi
Lingjing Kong
Tao Lin
Kaicheng Yu
Boi Faltings
dcterms:description: GCIL-CIFAR100 is a dataset designed for evaluating models in a class-incremental learning setting, specifically using the CIFAR100 dataset.
dcterms:title: GCIL-CIFAR100
